body_html:
Thank you! Are you sure that version you mentioned has a whl file under nightly-matrix-linux-gpu <https://ci.tensorflow.org/view/Nightly/job/nightly-matrix-linux-gpu/TF_BUILD_IS_OPT=OPT,TF_BUILD_IS_PIP=PIP,TF_BUILD_PYTHON_VERSION=PYTHON2,label=gpu-linux/> ? I have not found it. Is it OK to just install the latest whl file? Will the change of tf.reduce_sum function be reverted/missed somehow in this latest version?
…
On 4 September 2017 at 03:19, Justine Tunney ***@***.***> wrote: Stack Overflow says this was resolved by d93a55b <d93a55b>. Try installing the nightly whl file <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow#installation> and let us know if it doesn't work. If that is the case, I'll reopen this issue. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#12731 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ASsNxtzkD7JdWYy0V-AqtIoJlr1-QO0oks5se14lgaJpZM4PI67y> .
-- Best Regards, Yours Sincerely Ruomei
body_text:
Thank you! Are you sure that version you mentioned has a whl file under
nightly-matrix-linux-gpu
<https://ci.tensorflow.org/view/Nightly/job/nightly-matrix-linux-gpu/TF_BUILD_IS_OPT=OPT,TF_BUILD_IS_PIP=PIP,TF_BUILD_PYTHON_VERSION=PYTHON2,label=gpu-linux/>
 ?

I have not found it.

Is it OK to just install the latest whl file? Will the change of
tf.reduce_sum function be reverted/missed somehow in this latest version?
…
On 4 September 2017 at 03:19, Justine Tunney ***@***.***> wrote:
 Stack Overflow says this was resolved by d93a55b
 <d93a55b>. Try
 installing the nightly whl file
 <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow#installation> and let us know
 if it doesn't work. If that is the case, I'll reopen this issue.

body:
Thank you! Are you sure that version you mentioned has a whl file under
nightly-matrix-linux-gpu
<https://ci.tensorflow.org/view/Nightly/job/nightly-matrix-linux-gpu/TF_BUILD_IS_OPT=OPT,TF_BUILD_IS_PIP=PIP,TF_BUILD_PYTHON_VERSION=PYTHON2,label=gpu-linux/>
 ?

I have not found it.

Is it OK to just install the latest whl file? Will the change of
tf.reduce_sum function be reverted/missed somehow in this latest version?

On 4 September 2017 at 03:19, Justine Tunney <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Stack Overflow says this was resolved by d93a55b
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/d93a55b8>. Try
> installing the nightly whl file
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow#installation> and let us know
> if it doesn't work. If that is the case, I'll reopen this issue.
>
